questions.question: The documents which allow an aircraft entry to a country:
options: a. must be typewritten.
b. can be hand-written in block capitals in ink or indelible pencil.
c. are accepted at the discretion of the State of arrival.
d. must be typewritten or sent in electronic data format.

questions.question: Can an oral declaration concerning the passenger or crew baggage be acceptable?
options: a. Never.
b. Yes.
c. Only crew baggage.
d. Only passenger baggage.

questions.question: The General Declaration is signed by the:
options: a. the pilot-in-command only.
b. the pilot-in-command or the Agent.
c. any flight crew member.
d. the Operator.

questions.question: Where an aircraft registered in a Contracting State is making a flight over foreign territory for non-commercial purposes or is landing for non-traffic purposes, advanced notification is to be given to the foreign State. The information is to be received:
options: a. at least 2 hours in advance of arrival.
b. at least 4 hours in advance of arrival.
c. at least 1 hour in advance of arrival.
d. at least 12 hours in advance of the planned ETA.

questions.question: The ICAO annex which deals with the entry and departure of persons and their baggage for international flights is:
options: a. Annex 6.
b. Annex 15.
c. Annex 9.
d. Annex 8.

questions.question: In cases where a visitor travelling by air holds a valid passport and no visa is required of him, Contracting States:
options: a. shall not require the traveller to obtain any other identity document before boarding the aeroplane.
b. may require the traveller to obtain any other identity document before boarding the aeroplane.
c. in certain cases may require additional identification documents.
d. none of the above answers is correct.
